duties_responsibilities.duty: Design laboratory building footprint and layout.
Oversee installation and commissioning of equipment.
Supervise Spectrometry, Metallographic, Physical Testing, and Chemistry laboratories.
Manage resources effectively, including people, time, and budget, to optimize laboratory operations.
Maintain accreditation in the Spectrometry and Mechanical Test Labs through monitoring and auditing activities.
Maintain laboratory instrumentation and oversee capital development.
Audit test data, particularly during the qualification of new equipment.
Control scheduling, training, safety, human relations problems, and record-keeping.
Supervise the preparation of certifications for customers.
Provide Metallurgy Quality Systems support, focusing on measurement assurance.
Establish a link between customer product quality and operational availability of fabricating area equipment.
Promote and practice Aluminum Dynamics Business System concepts and cultural behaviors within your area of responsibility.

education_certification.credential: Bachelors degree in Metallurgical Engineering, Materials Science, Mathematics, Chemistry Engineering, or a related field (Master's preferred).
